snippet: An executive at a port security company, partly owned by a major donor to Senator Robert Menendez, said one of the senator’s former aides would be involved.
abstract: Lucrative port security contract pushed by Sen Robert Menendez of New Jersey on behalf of a company owned by Dr Salomon E Melgen, one of his major donors, would also have benefited Pedro Pablo Permuy, a former senior legislative aide to Menendez; relationship between Menendez and Dr Melgen is under scrutiny as the senator prepares to assume chairmanship of the Senate Foreign Relations Committee.
lead_paragraph: An executive at a port security company, partly owned by a major donor to Senator Robert Menendez, said one of the senator’s former aides would be involved.

headline.seo: Port Deal Pushed by Menendez Could Also Benefit Ex-Aide
headline.main: Port Deal Pushed by Menendez Could Benefit Former Aide, Not Just a Major Donor
headline.print_headline: Port Deal Pushed by Menendez Could Benefit Former Aide, Not Just a Major Donor
